Title: The Best Kind of Leader ï½œ Tao Te Ching Chapter 67 Explained (Part 3)

Content.Knowledge Point: The importance of compassion in battle and defense
Content.Text: Compassion gives you victory in battle and strength in defense. When heaven comes to your rescue, with its compassion, it keeps you safe.

Content.Knowledge Point: The value of economy and giving without wastefulness
Content.Text: If you're not wasteful, you can be giving.

Content.Knowledge Point: The significance of humility and restraint in leadership
Content.Text: Only through not striving to put ourselves into leadership positions can we ultimately become qualified to lead.

Content.Knowledge Point: The wisdom of not correcting others and allowing events to take their course
Content.Text: The true master doesn't often correct. It's the novice who is the most pedantic. The person who says the most is often the person with the least value to add.

Content.Knowledge Point: The importance of letting leadership happen naturally
Content.Text: The best way to become a leader is to let it happen naturally, if it happens at all.

Content.Knowledge Point: The dangers of seeking power and the risks of playing God
Content.Text: There are times to interfere and act, but we must know when these are by using our restraint and our intuition.
